page.paragraph: Listen to a conversation between a student and an office worker.
Can you help me, please?
Yes?
I have a question for you.
I'll answer if I can. What's your question?
Um…I'd like to find out about the auditions for the musical. Do you know anything about the auditions?
I do. I can help you with that. What would you like to know?
Well, first of all, when are the auditions?
The auditions are next week on Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday.
Any time on those days?

Well, you need to sign up for a specific time on one of those days. The sign-up sheets are posted right over there on the wall, and there're still some time slots left. You can sign up right now. Any other questions?
Yes, actually…I'd like to know what the auditions are like…I mean…what'll I need to do at the audition, and what do I need to prepare before the audition? Do I need to prepare a scene to perform?
Yes. You should prepare a scene, just a short scene, to perform.
What kind of scene do you suggest?

As I said, just a short scene, and since this production is a comedy, I wouldn't do anything too serious and heavy if I were you. Something light would certainly be better than something serious and dramatic.
OK, so you think it's best to do a scene that's light and funny?
And make it short.
OK, a short scene that's light and funny.
And you should be prepared to sing and dance, too…You do sing and dance? It's a musical you're auditioning for, after all.
I think I sing pretty well…
Have you had any training…any training as a singer?
Yes, I've had quite a bit of training. I sang in the school choir throughout high school, and I sang in quite a few productions, and I even had two years of private lessons.
It sounds like you're prepared for the singing part of the audition…but what about dancing? There's a lot of dancing in this production.
I haven't studied dancing, and, well, I don't dance as well as I sing. In fact, I don't dance well at all. To say I have two left feet would be an understatement.
Have you had any training in dance at all?
No.
And have you done any dancing in any of the productions you were in?
Just a little, and it didn't go very well.

Well, why don't you try out anyway? There may be some non-dancing roles in the production. Why don't you sign up for an audition? Look, there seems to be an open slot at three o'clock on Thursday. Are you free then?
I am. I guess I'll take that slot. It sounds like I should prepare a scene and then also prepare a song for the audition. Is that right?
Yes, that's it, a scene and a song.
And maybe not a dance?
Right!
